docs.snippet: Plenette Pierson scored 9 of her 22 points in the fourth quarter as the host Liberty recovered after giving up nearly all of a 19-point lead in the third quarter and beat the Seattle Storm....
docs.lead_paragraph: Plenette Pierson scored 9 of her 22 points in the fourth quarter as the host Liberty recovered after giving up nearly all of a 19-point lead in the third quarter and beat the Seattle Storm.

docs.snippet: The Nets payroll — once they complete a trade for Kevin Garnett and Paul Pierce — will be about $98 million, triggering a tax bill of about $75 million....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Nets payroll — once they complete a trade for Kevin Garnett and Paul Pierce — will be about $98 million, triggering a tax bill of about $75 million.
docs.abstract: Brooklyn Nets payroll, once trade for Kevin Garnett and Paul Pierce is completed, will be about $98 million; figure will trigger tax bill of about $75 million, more than double the total of taxes paid by all 30 NBA teams combined in the 2011-12 season.

headline.main: Record Luxury Tax Looms for the Nets
headline.print_headline: Record Luxury Tax Looms for the Nets

docs.snippet: Restaurant owners like Eric King have been highly critical of the employer health insurance mandate, and he said the rule’s delay “gives us another year to plan.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: Restaurant owners like Eric King have been highly critical of the employer health insurance mandate, and he said the rule’s delay “gives us another year to plan.”
docs.abstract: Restaurant owners with 50 full-time employees or more are highly critical of employer health insurance mandate outlined in Obama health care law, and are relieved at rule's one-year delay; owners like Eric King of Shanty Grille in Ellicott City, Md, say that postponement will give them more time to figure out how to offset costs of providing all employees with health insurance.

headline.main: At Restaurant, Delay Is Help on Health Law
headline.print_headline: At Restaurant, Delay Is Help On Health Law

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

docs.snippet: Dominic Smith’s parents always wanted better things for their son, a left-handed-hitting first baseman who recently signed a $2.6 million contract with the Mets....
docs.lead_paragraph: Dominic Smith’s parents always wanted better things for their son, a left-handed-hitting first baseman who recently signed a $2.6 million contract with the Mets.
docs.abstract: Profile of Dominic Smith, first baseman who recently signed a $2.6 million contract with New York Mets; Smith's expresses well-founded incredulity about being drafted, given that he is African-American and grew up in a neighborhood of south Los Angeles from which youth programs for low-income families have dried to a trickle; African-Americans accounted for only 8.5 percent of major league roster spots on opening day 2013.

headline.main: A New Life for the Mets Prospect Dominic Smith
headline.print_headline: New Life for a New Met
